intro: Siphocampylus rictus, commonly known as the scarlet pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of theApiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow flowers that change to red as they mature, often blooming in response to sunlight. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Siphocampylus rictus is known for its rapid growth and ability to flourish in disturbed habitats.
